verbose_text: Although UG, GN, and other GC-C related agonists are known to stimulate production of cGMP via activation of GC-C, in epithelial cells lining the GI tract, and cultured T84 and Caco-2 cells [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR], it was of interest to evaluate if orally administered plecanatide could stimulate cGMP production within the murine colon.
evidence: GC-C related agonists are known to stimulate production of cGMP
